name: positive
content:
positive adjective
(HOPEFUL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 full of hope and confidence, or giving cause for hope and confidence: a positive attitude On a more positive note, we're seeing signs that the housing market is picking up. The past ten years have seen some very positive developments in East-West relations. There was a very positive response to our new design - people seemed very pleased with it. Opposite
negative (WITHOUT HOPE)
More examplesFewer examplesThe most important thing is to go into the exam feeling positive.It's a humbling experience to see people being so positive about life when they have so little.He has a fairly positive outlook on life.While claiming to promote positive images of women, advertisers are in fact doing the very opposite.The UN called on all parties in the conflict to take a positive stance towards the new peace initiative.

positive adjective
(GRAMMAR)
language
  specialized A positive sentence or phrase is not a negative sentence (= one that states that something is false) or a question: "I have a plan" is a positive sentence. Compare
negative
language
  specialized A positive adjective or adverb is not comparative (= expressing the idea of "more") or superlative (= expressing the idea of "most"): Grammarians would say we are descending the descriptive scale for adjectives, from superlative to comparative to positive.
